item.title: Rosalee add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "To cease to think creatively is to cease to live" -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Rosalee add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Character is plot, plot is character." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Rosalee add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Literature is my Utopia" -- Helen Keller

item.title: Rosalee add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Classic' - a book which people praise and don't read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Rosalee add a quote by Dodie Smith
item.description: "I was wandering around as usual, in my unpleasantly populated sub-conscious..." -- Dodie Smith

item.title: Rosalee add a quote by Susanna Clarke
item.description: "Mr. Robinson was a polished sort of person. He was so clean and healthy and pleased about everything that he positively shone - which is only to be expected in a fairy or an angel, but is somewhat disconcerting in an attorney." -- Susanna Clarke

item.title: Rosalee add a quote by Susanna Clarke
item.description: "..The argument he was conducting with his neighbor as to whether the English magician had gone mad because he was a magician, or because he was English." -- Susanna Clarke

item.title: Rosalee add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Rosalee add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Let us step into the night and pursue that flighty temptress, adventure." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Rosalee add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Nitwit! Blubber! Oddment! Tweak!" -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Rosalee add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Oooh, look, a Blibbering Humdinger!" -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Rosalee add a quote by Garth Nix
item.description: "Does the walker choose the path, or the path the walker?" -- Garth Nix

item.title: Rosalee add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "The Road goes ever on and on Down from the door where it began. Now far ahead the Road has gone, And I must follow, if I can, Pursuing it with eager feet, Until it joins some larger way Where many paths and errands meet. And whither then? I cannot say" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rosalee add a quote by Chaim Potok
item.description:
"Human beings do not live forever, Reuven. We live less than the time it takes to blink an eye, if we measure our lives against eternity. So it may be asked what value is there to a human life. There is so much pain in the world. What does it mean to have to suffer so much if our lives are nothing more than the blink of an eye?
I learned a long time ago, Reuven, that a blink of an eye in itself is nothing. But the eye that blinks, that is something. A span of life is nothing. But the man who lives that span, he is something. He can fill that tiny span with meaning, so its quality is immeasurable though its quantity may be insignificant. Do you understand what I am saying? A man must fill his life with meaning, meaning is not automatically given to life.
It is hard work to fill one's life with meaning. That I do not think you understand yet. A life filled with meaning is worthy of rest. I want to be worthy of rest when I am no longer here." -- Chaim Potok

item.title: Rosalee add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rosalee add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rosalee add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Never laugh at live dragons." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rosalee add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Little by little, one travels far" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rosalee add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Do not meddle in the affairs of wizards, for they are subtle and quick to anger." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rosalee add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Fantasy is escapist, and that is its glory. If a soldier is imprisioned by the enemy, don't we consider it his duty to escape?. . .If we value the freedom of mind and soul, if we're partisans of liberty, then it's our plain duty to escape, and to take as many people with us as we can!" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rosalee add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "It's the job that's never started as takes longest to finish." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rosalee add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Rosalee add a quote by Megan Whalen Turner
Rosalee add a quote by Megan Whalen Turner
item.description: "If I am the pawn of the gods, it is because they know me so well, not because they make my mind up for me." -- Megan Whalen Turner

item.title: Rosalee add a quote by Megan Whalen Turner
Rosalee add a quote by Megan Whalen Turner
item.description: "This is the stupidest plan I have ever in my career participated in," Xenophon said. "I love stupid plans," said Eugenides." -- Megan Whalen Turner

item.title: Rosalee add a quote by Megan Whalen Turner
Rosalee add a quote by Megan Whalen Turner
Rosalee add a quote by Megan Whalen Turner
item.description: "From shadow queen to puppet queen in one rule," he whispered. "That's very impressive. When he rules your country and he tells you he loves you, I hope you believe him." He anticipated her blow and leaned back. Her hand only brushed his cheek in an entirely unsatisfying manner. "At least that's one lie I didn't tell you." -- Megan Whalen Turner

item.title: Rosalee add a quote by Megan Whalen Turner
item.description: "She pulled the bedclothes up as far as they would go and suppressed a perverse wish to have her old nurse come to chase away the darkness, perverse because she didn't know if she wanted the shadows to be empty or not." -- Megan Whalen Turner
